text: Great experience, had what I needed. Although this stores parking lot is way too small, makes it dangerous while wheeling your purchase.

name: Susan Pollitz
text: Always find just what I need very clean store !!

name: Kathy Hester
text: We were at Lowe's to check out the spring flowers. They have a beautiful selection! Everyone I spoke with was so helpful, knowledgeable and friendly. Thanks Lowe's!!  🌺🌷🌸🌼🌹

name: ANTHONY HAMILTON
text: Awesome customer service

name: Dr. D
text: I purchased a stove and everything that could go wrong did and with terrible customer support. First they never called me to confirm my delivery date of my product. I found it online which was a Monday. Well they showed up Sunday unannounced. Lucky i was there but unfortunately there was a dent. I called that day to Lowes Online Customer Support which stated someone will call me from the store that it was fulfilled to fix the problem. I called the store this time and they wanted me to uninstall everything and just give me a whole new one which i stated that I couldn't do that because i paid someone to connect everything which would mean that i would have to pay them again. She stated that they couldn't help me with that. I finally convinced them to just order the storage shelve that was dented and it would maybe take 2 months. At this point Im like whatever. They get me to Chris the appliance guy and he states that they have a whole unit in stock and they would deliver that shelve to me the next day. I was happy and ready to put this behind me. If only it was that easy. Chris stated that someone would call me the next morning to inform me of the time frame that day for delivery. They never called or showed up. That was Monday. I have been calling multiply time today to try and get this resolved but no one is answering their phone in the delivery department. Very frustrated and wish this issue would be fixed already

name: Layla Hening
text: Hit or miss if there is customer service available but nice store all in all

name: Marquis C Jones Sr.
text: Awesome experience today... I love it at this Lowe's

name: Joshua Baker
text: Found the exact ceiling tiles I needed. Reasonable in price.

name: preston davis AL
text: Good store hours I can go in before work if I need something

name: Katie Malone
text: I recently purchased appliances for the first time from Lowe's. This was the worst experience I have ever had with a store - big or small. After multiple set up deliveries that never showed, I had to call the store, spend way too long on the call carousel, and ultimately had to take my complaints to corporate. When they were forced to call me back, I felt like my problems had been resolved, and my appliance would be delivered. The next day, I received an email that my fridge was ready to be picked up. After calling the store AGAIN, it was finally sorted out. I think I got lucky and spoke to someone who cared that it had been nearly two months of waiting. After the microwave with the original delivery didn't fit my space, Lowe's in Fultondale denied my return on day 57 of 60 with no reasoning except that their "policy had just changed." I will no longer shop at Lowe's. What a nightmare.

name: Jay Em Gee
text: I could live here. Selection is bomb staff is e extremely helpful and knowledgable. Prices hiiiii high

text: What is there to say, this is a toy store for adults.

name: MB Mack
text: I always gave a good experience here but the only problem besides the wood shortage, which isn't their fault, was that the wood they did have was not very organized and labeled. I also had to go to the parking lot for a cart.

name: Amanda Lance
text:
I've tried to call Lowe's for days. I walk into Lowe's today and trying to ask for help while watching 2 separate employees goof off. One boy even hanging with his friend while I waited for help. And after one guy helped me and rushed to finish with me and gave me the wrong part so he could get back to his friend.
I saw customersreluctant to engage him because they thought he was also with a customer who was actually the friend. they were making plans for what they wanted to do after he got off.

text:
I shop here often. I have found the employees to be helpful and able to direct me to the right person if they themselves do not know the answer to my question.  I buy my lumber from here for home projects and yard supplies. I also purchase plumbing, hardware and some tools here as well. Good location for where I live and most often they have what I need in stock. Some time I will come to just look and see what has changed.
I like this location. Two thumbs up!

name: Henry Strevy
text: No one knows their sections where they work

name: Herman Carter (Sonny)

name: T-WON Price

name: Kenneth Stewart
text: After searching for half an hour for a sliding door locking bar and no one willing to help I will not be back.

name: Reauchann Richardson
text: Beautiful plants but i did not get them. I am a regular at Lowes. Lol

name: Tonya Sanders
text: I went to this location to buy a washer, the guy in appliance was all over the place to busy to help anyone. I finally got his attention long enough for him to tell me they are sold out of washers. That they only had one left. Well I got the one they had. Waited a week to get it delivered when it arrived it was dented up, I sent it back they brought me another out. After getting it in and hooked up and reading the manual on it it wasn’t what I was looking for. I might would have realized that had the guy that was half way helping us wouldn’t have been so pushy on us making our mind up. I called them over an hour with no answer are they would pick up and hang up. So I went down there the manager was outright rude and rolled her eyes at me. Finally got some help in getting it scheduled for pick up and refunded. So I went to the Loews in Trussville to get another washer because this location said the same thing we are sold out. Fultondale was supposed to pick this washer up today and Trussville bring my new one out. Fultondale still has not picked up their washer yet and I have tried to call for over an hour and no answer or the hang up on me. I am a manager and know how busy and crazy it can be but that is why you have employees with good customer service skills to help. Fultondale dose not have good management or customer service.

name: Richard Bice
text: Great I had what I needed only thing it took to man a long time to come over and help me find it

name: Kenneth Rouse
text: No need to call this store will not answer the phone I called for 3 days

name: Debbie Wood
text: I understand the plexiglass shield at register, but why is debit machine pushed so far back from glass that your face is pushed up against the glass just to reach the machine?

name: James “XDMAN” Nicholas
text: Love this location

name: James Miller
text: My home away from home

name: Stephen Tillman

name: MERIA TV

name: Justin Keeton

name: Greg Melvin
text: I stopped into the Lowe’s at Fultondale today and had the most pleasant experience ever. Orlandria in the paint department was very kind and quickly helped me find the exact kind of paint I was needing. She gave very professional and polite service.

name: Kathryn Mills
text: Everyone has always been so helpful when we needed them.

name: Leslie Mize
text: We always go to Lowe's in fultondale for our live Christmas trees..they are easily accessible and have people to help you net them and put them into your car..very reasonable and we had to keep our tree up after Christmas for our grandsons visit and it looked just as fresh as it did when we purchased it..and very few needles fall off..i do recommend the tree stuff they sell in a bottle for like 2 or 3 dollars..it does extend the life of your tree and helps to keep it from drying out and a fire starting..always unplug trees guys when leaving home regardless..happy holidays

name: Terrie Teeter
text: No one there to help

name: Diane Jackson
text: I went to Lowe s today to buy 15 bags of Pine Mulch.  Their Cashier could not get anyone to help her and did not know how to even pull it up by name.  I wasted my time, Gas messing with your staff.  It was a horrible experience.  I ended up leaving and going to Ace in Gardendale.  No only was the price better but the staff there knew exactly what i needed.  They were great!!!!   Forget Lowes and go to Ace.  You wont regret it.

name: Misty Steele
text: Nice home improvement stuff

name: carron collie

name: J Frost
text: My home Improvement go to. Better than Depot or ACE.

name: Michelle Crowley

name: Daman Cross
text: I had been avoiding going to Lowe's because the last time that we where there I was in pretty good health but since then I have had some issues to arise and I can not walk long distances any more so I was very surprised when we arrived and I saw that they had the carts to assist you with getting around the store thank you so much for that you just do not know I relieved I was and I was able to purchase everything that I had been putting off to do.  Thank you so much again.

name: Alex Berryhill
text: The people were very rude and very slow. I'm a contractor and it messes my whole day up when I have to go. Sadly it's not just one it almost every lowes or home depot

name: Mazy Holiday
text: I have tried to call this store's delivery department and/or someone who can have an order waiting at the store delivered (when you cannot go pick it up) and No One answered the phone for 4 days of calling.  Whether you get the operator or not, whether you tell the operator you problem, doesn't matter how you go about it, you cannot get anyone to help you. When you get someone from a different department on the phone, they either put you on hold forever, or transfer you to another unmanned phone.  How they have 4 stars is a mystery, clearly no one is calling them for assistance.

name: Jimmy Welch
text:
Never had a bad experience shopping here....Today replaced the bad thermocouple on my water heater.
Looks like a 10 dollar part fixed the problem.
Pilot light would not stay lit.
Working now. ......installed a Honeywell thermocouple...24 inch.

name: Nora Stacy
text: Fast courteous staff and well laid out.  Easy to find isles. Clean restrooms.  Handicapped parking.  Good helpful advice

name: Donny Davis
text: Has everywhere else their prices is too high

name: Kerry Anthony
text: Most times, i find what i need. And the staff is helpful as well.

name: Gary Jones
text: Absolutely horrible service

name: Grace Scott
text: Great place to get things for home improvements

name: Kumayama Dojo
text: It's Lowe's, y'all! Why do you need my review? They're outstanding!

name: Katie Franklin
text:
This is the worse experience ever. I went in on Friday order blocks for my new home being delivered today and I had to call to see why it was taken so long guess what they dont even have the blocks. How can you make someone pay for something and guarantee they will be delivered by that day if you dont have it.
On top of that no one called me to let me know ,I called them because my home is here.
Thank you Fultondale Lowes for the worse Service Ever. I WILL NEVER BE BACK.

name: George Alford
text: I love Lowe's. Everyone is helpful. I like their prices and warranties on their tools.

name: don hoskins

text: I use this Lowe’s frequently. Never had a problem finding things or getting help. Once in awhile there won’t be but a register or 2 open, some wait, but all and all it’s my go to store.

name: Katie Taylor
text: Understaffed at paint counter every time. Only one person working on a Saturday. That is poor management or poor cross training.

name: James Bowling
text: Its lowes what more can you say.

name: Ann McAnnally
text: I was in the garden shop, thought I was going to pass out from the heat. The line wound all the way back to the rear. Only had one register open. I am 83 yrs old and had 3 bags of sand which all of it had gotten damp and I had to stop a customer in parking lot to help me load it in my car. Very, very poor service.

name: Lane Lord
text: Website showed specific lumber in stock-wrong, it wasn't. Almost a wasted trip but an associate directed me towards a local supplier who had what I needed.

name: Jaxon 1
text: Kind of hard to locate items here

name: AJ Sperling
text: Awful customer service at register.  The young lady needs a serious lesson in customer service, this was my second encounter with her, she is lazy.

name: Britney Dixon
text: Just wanted to take the time out of my busy day to let everyone know that Tim L in paint has great customer service. He took the time out to help us every step of the way he was really nice. I will for sure be back to. Please let him know he did a great job today. And also the store manager Rob is always so nice whenever me and my family comes in. Thanks Rob and Tim L in paint.

name: cute watermelon
text: If you need to fix anything, you can generally find it yourself because the store is set up that way.

name: Erica Shelnut
text: Employees are very helpful and knowledgeable. They always had everything we're looking for. Customer service is also extremely friendly and it doesn't give me a migraine to deal with them.

name: Merrily Serota
text: Lowe's most always has what's needed. If out of stock, the product will be ordered and can be picked up or delivered.

name: Bonlynren McG
text:
I most always find what I want or need here.  However,  today there were no employees around to ask paint questions to.  😓 There was one lady working in that department but she was  with a customer.  After meandering around,  trying to find the correct the paint,  I asked a gentleman,  who was a customer.  Thank GOODNESS,  he was  extremely knowledgeable and stayed with me for 10 minutes until I found the exact product I needed for my wooden steps.

So,  why do I see a lot of employees working yet and no one is available to ask a simple question of?  Yes,  I could have interrupted her,  like several others did.  But I chose not to do that.

name: Micah Moore
text: Worse customer service ever. Employees are very rude and do not have proper communication skills.  Refused to help customers and had multiple people waiting and do not answer phones.  Constantly saying things are not there jobs. Just completely unacceptable.

name: Erica Hawkins
text: I recently made several improvements to my home in preparation to put it on the market. I probably visited Lowe’s at least 2-3 times a week for over a month. Their department customer service is lacking. I learned to just ask the some customers because they seemed to know more than the employees. There was an exception and that was the Pro-Desk employees. They’re great Monday through Friday. Don’t waste your time checking out up front, if you’re preparing for a project, go through the pro-desk area. They know what they’re doing.

name: Jose Navarro
text: Great visit

name: Hunter Cornelius
text:
I've never had an issue with Lowe's. Then again, I dont go there often
But they always tend to have what I need

name: Jeff Vaughn (Kilroy5150)
text: Going here for Hardware is always a toss-up, you never know what you're going to get especially when it comes to getting questions answered and getting help. Sometimes I visit here and the experience is great, sometimes I visit here and it's less than what I expect. I suppose it all depends on the individuals who make up the staff that determines what kind of experience you will get at a certain day.

name: Taylor Mathews
text: They keep this location clean and most isles tidy and organized. The problem is the checkout lines they usually have several cashiers but for some reason it will take you longer to check out here than select your products. The staff is very friendly and helpful.

name: Bonlynren McG
text:
I most always find what I want or need here.  However,  today there were no employees around to ask paint questions to.  😓 There was one lady working in that department but she was  with a customer.  After meandering around,  trying to find the correct the paint,  I asked a gentleman,  who was a customer.  Thank GOODNESS,  he was  extremely knowledgeable and stayed with me for 10 minutes until I found the exact product I needed for my wooden steps.

So,  why do I see a lot of employees working yet and no one is available to ask a simple question of?  Yes,  I could have interrupted her,  like several others did.  But I chose not to do that.

text: The store is convenient and the department workers are knowledgeable. The cashier are NOT friendly and some even down right rude. text: Normally I would give Lowes around 4 stars, however, the Lowes in Fultondale is awful. Things, especially in plumbing, are out of place and very unorganized. With the exception of a few employees its hard to find anyone that can really help you. Im not the only one that feels this way and if there were any competition in the area I know they would do little to no business. This location certainly needs to be evaluated at the corporate level.

name: Collins
text:
Horrible customer service!
I placed an order online yesterday, so I could get an early start on my home project. The plan was to run by Lowe’s, grab my order, and leave. After sitting, walking, and standing around for a little over an hour- my order still had not been pulled and put together yet.

I asked for a refund and went to my car, I sat in Lowe’s parking lot and placed an online order  at Home Depot and received a text within an hour and a half that my order was already ready for pickup.

Will never use Lowe’s (especially in Fultondale) again!

Same thing happened last time I shopped for wood...there were wood carts inside but were full of things blocking the wood and aisles yet appeared not to belong to customers. I had to go out into the parking lot to get a cart....none near the doors. The last two times I have shopped for a power tool the aisles have also been blocked with ladders and merchandise yet no employees around that appear to be stocking. They apparently just drop it in the aisles and leave it there. Come on guys!! Looks like they need some new management!

She said she would find someone to help and left me for 15 minutes and came back and keyed something in and sold it to me. I was late picking up my son from school causing him to be sent to after school care and charging me $50. I am disgusted with this place and won't be back. Lowe's needs to hire people that actually care before they lose all of their businesses. Home Depot needs to come to the area and shut them down.

I was very impressed with this store for not losing the wrenches in the Christmas return horror that most stores have and for keeping them for me. I also want to give a special shout out to Debra who went and found the wrenches for me on the 23rd and took my order, thank you so much for saving my son's Christmas! As every Lowes in my area was sold out of them and that is what he wanted.

name: Jacqueline Dorris
text: This Lowes really needs to work on their employee culture and overall customer service. Over the past several years, my husband and I have purchased several large appliances. All of which were a nightmare of an experience.  No communication about delivery and expectations once your item is paid for. No delivery confirmations/calls from the "warehouse". The first items were a washer and dryer and fridge - they showed up 2 days late. Frustrating considering we needed the items urgently AND we took time off to be there at delivery time. Most recent was a dishwasher. The man in the back who sold us the dishwasher seemed like he would rather be anywhere BUT work. Honestly, we would have walked right out if it wasn't for the fact that I had some rewards to use at Lowes. He gave no information and in fact, told me I should "search online and compare dishwashers" because he wasn't an expert and didn't have a say on any of them. Then we asked about delivery. He had no info - not even on the process and we explained we had a bad experience before. Instead of sticking up for or explaining to us that maybe it was a fluke, he went on to talk about the "warehouse" and how many complaints they get on them. Not very reassuring. Our dishwasher didn't show up today so we will be canceling our order and we just opened a Home Depot account - so Lowes, you have lost a customer.

name: Sir Consumer
text:
Today July 7, 2020, Lowe's in Fultondale seems to minimize the risk of Covid 19 by allowing patrons to opt in or out on a county wide mask wearing mandate. Sadly I noticed today and  just a few days ago the same practices. THE MASK should cover the nose and the mouth! It isn't a college or super intellectual level of comprehension. Air is taken in thru the nasal passage as well as by mouth.
Jefferson County is under a county wide mask required mandate. This is to protect everyone. This mandate is essential in providing some precautions allowing businesses to stay open. Why are patrons allowed to enter Lowe's without a mask?? No mask No entry.
Cigerettes and pets aren't allowed due to potential dangers and risk to others. Wearing a mask is no different. It provides some safety measures as the rules No Pets and No Smoking inside.

text:
Went to the local Lowe's to purchase some blinds.  I needed one to be cut to fit my window but left after waiting for an hour and never getting any help.  I asked multiple employees, went to customer service to get help, and even called them on the phone from within the store hoping to reach someone that could help.  No one ever came.   One employee did try to get someone to come help us but no one ever did.

This is not my first experience having extended wait times only to have no one come to help.  In addition checkout wait times are usually high when I have been as there are only one or two registers open.  Even when they see the lines building up it takes them so long to get another register open that it's pointless.

name: Melissa Thomas
text: My husband, a veteran and law enforcement officer, and I just left this location not even 10 minutes ago. We went in to return a work desk that he had purchased yesterday, only to come home and find out that pieces are broken and missing. When we arrived at the return desk we were greeted angrily by a lady named Shelia (her tag said CSA Front Desk). She was in the process of helping another gentleman with a wheelbarrow at the time we arrived so I shrugged her attitude off as frustration to begin with. By the time she got to us she took the receipt from my husband, asked angrily what was wrong to which he informed her that the desk portion (the main part of the item) was broken down the middle and pieces were missing. She rolled her eyes, mumbled a few things, then started to walk away and as she was walking into another room yelled back at us "you know it's a clearance item right?!"  She then came back out of that room, struggled to get the lid off the box and then continued to tell us in a displeasing tone that our kobalt work desk was on clearance. I then stated "so does clearance mean that pieces are broken? If so, lowes should not be selling clearance items". She then argued with me that clearance items are usually returns with missing pieces and I restated that the main portion of the item is completely broken in half. I don't care if it's clearance or not, it was not marked down nearly enough to compensate for a complete useless, damaged piece. She then slammed a refund receipt down and asked my husband to sign. She never asked if we wanted to swap it with a usable piece. She never asked anything, actually. During this entire transaction she was rude and everything anyone in customer service should not be. She was also complaining and cussing under her breath about no one answering the phone around there during our entire few minutes with her. When we were leaving there were 2 more men waiting patiently behind us and just staring in disbelief at what they witnessed and would unfortunately encounter. I told one man good luck as we walked off and he said it looked like he needed it. Needless to say, if lowes in fultondale is going to hire individuals of her caliber, we will not step foot back in that store and may in fact just take our business to Home Depot.

name: JohnDoe Beats
text: We went here to purchase cabinets, the process started on Nov. 21st 2016. We have spent over $20k in the past 6months. It took them four times to measure our kitchen correctly, also had a lady insult my fiancé in our own home. Finally when we ordered the cabinets a few weeks later, we were told it would take 30 days to get them in and possibly a week extra to get them installed. Two days before we were supposed to get the cabinets in we received an email from the man we was working with stating that he was sorry, the order was incorrect and said he was leaving that he couldn't help us any longer. Well 3 cabinets were missing, and was measured incorrectly...... AGAIN. Don is the assistant manager over there and is terrible. We met with him and got another person to come measure... again and said we had to wait another 30days before it could be here and another 1-2weeks to install. Well the installer said when they got here he couldn't finish the trim because something was not finished. Don has told us from the start that we would sit down and discuss what needs to be done to make this right. I have called lowes 20 times and got Don at least 10 and said he would call me back. HE NEVER DOES. I have asked for the store manager Jeff left messages, still no answer. We have been dealing with this for 6 months and spent a lot of money for a normal person. LOWES IS THE WORST STORE, MOST OF THEIR EMPLOYEES ARE RUDE AND HAVE NO CUSTOMER SERVICE ABILTIY AT ALL. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND LOWES TO ANYBODY EVER.

name: Tom Mosley
text: We recently purchased a Lawn mower from Lowe's and used it 2 times and then it started sputtering and smoking and would not crank.  We bought the extended warranty with the mower, but when we tried to bring it back they made us pay $80.00 to send it off to be worked on and then they called us a week later and told us the mower had contaminated gas and it would not be covered under the warranty and it was going to cost us $127.00 to fix. We put brand new gas in the mower before we used it.  We will NEVER again purchase one of Lowe's warranty's because they do NOT stand behind their product.

name: Colette H
text: I have been coming to this store for my painting needs for the past 5 years. I had the DISpleasure with an associate there today named Christina. I am still recovering/reconstructing my home after hurricane sally. I had bought a gallon of paint back in January that had leaked from the bottom all over my garage floor. I am just getting around to returning to the store to exchange it. Christina not only told me the associate selling me the paint in January sold me the wrong kind but then proceeded to argue with me and not give credit on the exchange. I’m told leaking cans happen (of which the other associate offered) but this apparently very unhappy (never smiled, devoid of social skills) person, Christina, would not credit a longtime customer for a faulty can of paint. I will not ever buy anything from this store (or Sherwin Williams) ever again. #onelesscustomer #sherwinwilliamspaint #nocustomerserviceskills #swpaint

resp.text: Hi Colette, Your feedback is very concerning to us. We'd like to discuss the situation with you and put you in touch with the appropriate contact who can assist.  Please contact us at 1-800-4Sherwin (474-3794) or by email at bit.ly/2Dgu0Tik. Please include the store location, if applicable, when reaching out to us. Sincerely, T.H., SW Customer Service Rep.
